Tervish never noticed that the amulet had vanished. It had disappeared not only from his possession, but from his memory as well.

"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Let no one say we did not fight until the last . . . ."
—Headstone fragment from a mass grave found in the Crimson Peaks
Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.
Sometimes it's best to let sleeping dragons lie.

"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"We are not yet free of Lim-Dûl's terrors."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

"Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"
—Plato, Phædo, trans. Jowett

"Living side by side with the elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

"Perhaps goblins are good for something after all."
—General Khurzog

"According to accepted theory, the grenade held some kind of flammable mixture and was carried to its target by a hapless goblin."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
If only it had three brains, too.

"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar,
The Underworld Cookbook

"On this site where Kjeld's blood was spilled, let none raise a fist or deny a beggar."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

"The Hand of Justice will come to cleanse the world if we are true."
—Oliver Farrel

"May Svyelun and her tides favor you."
—Traditional merfolk blessing

"Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."
—The Book of Tal

"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, death speaker

"The lemures looked harmless, until they descended on my troops. Within moments, only bones remained."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
Knowing the hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transciptions.
To become an officer, an Icatian soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.
Icatia's once peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

"This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first escape it."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"Let them see what is not there and feel what does not touch them. When they no longer trust their senses, that is the time to strike."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
The Isle of Wak-Wak, home to a tribe of winged folk, is named for a peculiar fruit that grows there. The fruit looks like a woman's head, and when ripe speaks the word "Wak."
Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.
Abandoning his sword to return to the lush forest of Pendelhaven, Jacques le Vert devoted his life to protecting the creatures of his homeland.

"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

"Expect my visit when the darkness comes. The night I think is best for hiding all."
—Ouallada

"With a great cry, the goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of knights penetrated its ranks."
—Tivadar of Thorn,
History of the Goblin Wars

Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the mesa pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a mesa pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.
The purpose of any moat is to impede attack. Some are filled with water, some with thistles. Some are filled with things best left unseen.
The Yeti's single greatest asset is its unnerving ability to blend in with its surroundings.

"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

"Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with orcish and goblin raiders."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I
What walks on four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon, and three legs in the evening?

"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

"Phyrexia's touch is painful to all but the blackest of hearts."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was big!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."
—Daria

"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of knights' quests.
Few can withstand the wrath of the righteous.

"Dwelling in icy mountain streams near goblin and orcish foes, the river merfolk were known for their stoicism."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess
The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, sea troll
Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.

"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

"My soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"I hear there are bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

"Striking silent as a dream,
Cutting short the strangled scream . . ."
—Tobrian, "Watchdragon"
The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.
What goes up, must come down.
Flawed copies of relics from the Thran Empire, the su-chi were inherently unstable but provided useful knowledge for Tocasia's students.
Magic often masters those who cannot master it.
Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's power.

"The danger in cultivating massive plants caught the elves by surprise."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

"Those idiots should never have bred thrulls for combat!"
—Jherana Rure

"Until the Rebellion, thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II
When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

"What tries to crush our spirit only strengthens our resolve."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
Fear the knight leaping from the water into the air, weapon ready.

"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

"'Tis the set of sails and not the gales
Which tells us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"

"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"
—William Shakespeare, King Lear

"It was in Urza's journals that I finally found the secret at the core of the summonings."
—Journal, author unknown

"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

"Few natural forces are as devastating as hunger."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

"I will go to any length to achieve my goal. Eternal life is worth any sacrifice."
—Zur the Enchanter
These spirits of the air are winsome and wild, and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.
Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.
Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."
—Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"
Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.
Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.
I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

"There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"
Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.
While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
—The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.
Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

"...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"
Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.
"Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock." —Norin the Wary
We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.
After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.
Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.
A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.
The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
—The Book of Tal

"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—Song of the Artificer
In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

"‘Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' ‘Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, ‘if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll
These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"
Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.
Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.
Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.
Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.
What goes up, must come down.
Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.
Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.
None know if this Giant is the result of aberrant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da
hurt'll disappear."
—Traditional
Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.
"This ‘standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.
The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

"What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."
 —Conrad Aiken
Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—/ The ice was all between."/—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."
A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.
Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.
I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.
Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

"Open the gates, and bid them enter."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"They're a hardy bunch, but I'd still bet that they just slept through the worst of the cold times."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Peace will come only when we have taken Varchild's head."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"Serve me, and live forever."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Living side by side with the Elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
If only it had three brains, too.

"This was quite possibly the least pleasant occurrence on the entire expedition."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"The scavengers who first found it called it the ‘Bone Crank.' Not a bad name, I'd say."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

"Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"The Guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

"The Guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

"Deal with the spawn of Phyrexia cautiously; only with time may we control them."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

"Deal with the spawn of Phyrexia cautiously; only with time may we control them."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"Let the past be the past. Do not call up that which you cannot put down. Destroy that which destroyed us, so long ago."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

"Embrace the storm. Its voice shall echo within you, and its fire shall become your touch!"
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

"Embrace the storm. Its voice shall echo within you, and its fire shall become your touch!"
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alient place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alient place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

"Few natural forces are as devastating as hunger."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

These small but intelligent Dragons and their Olesian allies held back the tide of Pashalik Mons's hordes of Goblin Raiders.
DragonCon 1994
This secret society of mages manipulates the beliefs and opinions of others.
"If the skies are our only refuge, I will see all of us take wing."
"We must spread Bant's light before we are shadowed over."
Soldiers who fought through Grixis learned to hit first, recite the prayer of Asha later.
Those who worship the great gargantuans could hardly be expected to fight with a subtle weapon.
Alarans commemorated its appearances with new holidays bearing names like the Great Cataclysm and the Fall of Ilson Gate.
An Esper mage will leave a hole in your memory with surgical precision. A Grixis mage sees no reason to be so kind.
The blood of the demons quickened as their master rose over the battlefield. The blood of the angels also quickened: here was the chance to finally end the war started millennia ago.
The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."
"Let us flee to the deep jungle. Our city is no longer safe—and I suspect neither is the fallback retreat."

"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol
Elspeth's squires do not seek advancement. For them, no knightly glory could surpass the glory of serving their champion.
"May the earth rise up to meet you."

"Stray not into sin, lest you face the doorman of an insatiable tomb."
—Prayer of Asha
Using a spine to break a slave's back appeals to the Grixis sense of irony.
They feared each other for their differences but were absolutely terrified at their similarities.

"Look there—they carry that one upon a sedan chair. It must be their leader. Wait . . . Oh! Perhaps not."
—Kaeda, aven scout
Every disaster holds mystery, for lack of a sane witness.
A match for any army—even its own.
The wilder the frontier, the greater the need for a controlling hand.
Stormcallers came to appreciate the novelty of Jund's volcanic updrafts.
"We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"
It was given life by the etherium of a hundred slain Esperites.
"See, children of metal? Already your bodies are rejecting harm. Continue on our path, and perfection will be yours."
An unbound page is a riddle, free of cover and of context, a favorite token of the hegemon.
When a battlefield falls silent, it's rarely due to a cease-fire.
"I craved enlightenment, and Crucius's etherium opened my eyes. I would share my sight with you, but first you must believe."
"We are born soldiers. The call to battle is a homecoming."
It waits with absolute stillness. One might think it a statue if it weren't occasionally seen chewing on its victims.
"Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"

"This is a new world and a new war. We need warriors who know chaos and how to combat it."
—Lisha of the Azure
"The behemoths are content to graze like cattle, while dragons rage and conquer. I know which example I'll follow."
In war-torn Alara, sometimes a wurm's gullet is the safest place to be.

"There is no glory in a death of age, as even the leotau know. As winter steals into their coats, they seek the deadliest lands, that they may die as they lived."
—Aarsil the Blessed

"To join our ranks, one must be pure. To be pure, one must be blessed by etherium. To be blessed, one must forget oneself."
—Ethersworn prayer
In the Maelstrom, a trick of the light can feast on human flesh.
For hours afterward, all they could see was the grisly silhouette of their master, screaming.
Wounded soldiers looked up, grateful for her appearance. But she passed over them, her eyes firmly on their foe.
The knights were halfway through their precombat rites before they realized the foul brute meant to start without them.
"I embrace all of Alara, Grixis as much as Bant. Let my former home call me traitor. I do this not for accolades, but because it is right."

"He is part of a new breed of guardian, one who embraces the best of both his world and ours."
—Mayael the Anima
Alara's burning blood cannot be contained by mere earth and stone.
Well suited are the nacatl to a coat of steel and forge-tempered claws.
The forlorn cries of the dead combine to make its laugh.

"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic
Death comes in the blink of an eye.
During the collision of the shards, entire ways of life disappeared without a trace.

"When the wielder is strong enough, any sword will do."
—Kresh the Bloodbraided
Giving a thing wings does not take away its fear of flight—or its fear of fire, for that matter.

"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."
"This violent wasteland is an indictment of its people. These cowards lack the will to oppose disorder."
So many aven had died scouting the distant fronts that the knight-captains recruited Nayan falcons as couriers.

"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."
—Sharuum the Hegemon
What happens when a plane of predators collides with four planes of prey?

"From the damned I make my garden."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth
As pure mana flooded across the shards, it brought a sense of unity even to Jund's vicious food chain.
The elves had entered a land like an open grave—an act of fortitude or folly?
Words describing it fail. Pages relating it shrivel. Tales recounting it end.
It crushes all underfoot, yet leaves no trace of its passage—no trampled debris, no flattened souls, not even a hoofprint.

"His body belongs to Bant now. His soul? I honestly don't know. I expect it belongs to the angels."
—Rafiq of the Many
Those who forget their past are doomed to be eaten by it.
It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.
An elder in one pride, of the Sigiled caste in another.

"In darkness is kindled the fiercest hope."
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya
For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.

"In this new world, I have seen the once-devout rhoxes take up arms with the savages of Jund. I would be offended, but I see the wisdom in their choice."
—Gernan, Dawnray archer
Godtrackers found new pantheons of beast-gods beyond Naya's borders.

"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol
The last thought to go through their victim's mind is the one they tear out through the scalp.
They are the masters of your mind.

"Too wary to charge, too prudent to serve. Not anymore."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
"One sigil awarded for valor, the other awarded for surviving Hellkite's Pass."
As the elves learned the hymns of angels, the knights learned the roars of titans.

"Do not mistake a behemoth's assistance for subservience."
—Mayael the Anima
Even the balmgivers of Bant couldn't heal the incurables, but sharing their torment helped.
Their newfound wings shined elegantly and functioned partially.
Nicol Bolas doesn't distinguish between servants and victims.

"Birth and death are both reversible."
—Nicol Bolas
The Maelstrom sent a wave of raw mana through the battlefield, carrying off the fighting and fallen alike.
A king in Jund, a serf in Esper.

"Some think its immunity to countermagic evolved because of the constant mage attacks on Naya. I think it just ate a bunch of wizards."
—Broka, drumhunter
No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"
The tips of her bolts are blunt, but her aim is deadly sharp.
Sigils corrupted by outsiders do not lose their power, only their purity.
"The volcanic winds make a maze of the skies of Jund. If we mean to invade, we must first learn their invisible paths."

"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan

"Etherium is limited. Innovation is not."
—Tezzeret
His name means "he who paints the earth red."

"I pray that I am never considered useless or old."
—Sharuum the Hegemon
Creations made in madness may contain great power. The path to that power is as labyrinthine as the creator's mind.
It strides through the whitecover, mists in which even gargantuans can hide.

"I appreciate the artistry of the telemins, but the creatures of the other worlds provide a much more dramatic performance."
—Ennor, mentalist
For four nights following Ennor's death and the reclaiming of his etherium, its recipients were found slain, the etherium ripped from their bodies.
"Etherium clouded my eyes, clogged my ears, desensitized my skin. Now that I can feel, I can begin to learn."
"Here is the proof that what has been done may yet be undone. The hope we thought dead will be gloriously reborn."
It provides what every discerning mage requires—time to think.
Bant mages still call to the heavens for aid, but angels are not the only ones who answer.
The nacatl called this new species "vetli," their word for poison arrows.

"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn

"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

"Don't try to hit your enemies. Concentrate on the space between them, and fill the air with doom."
—Spear-Tribe teaching
"Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."
For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.
Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug.
Witches of the Split-Eye Coven speak of a future when Grixis will overflow with life energy. For now, they must harvest vis from the living to fuel their dark magics.
They wait in darkened depths, laughing eagerly.

"The people of Akros must learn from our leonin adversaries. If we match their staunch ferocity with our superior faith, we cannot fail."
—Cymede, queen of Akros
The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
Many Tin Street shops display a sign on the door: "No cloaks allowed."
Small enough to penetrate the narrowest crack in a castle wall and numerous enough to hack apart a griffin.
Jund feasts on the unprepared.
Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses.
The first spell taught to young mages, it has spared the lives of many whose hands are too small to hold a sword.
Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.
With one motion, a pest is removed and a scourge inflicted.
Every once in a while, when they aren't getting incinerated in lava, crushed under rock slides, or devoured by dragons, goblins experience moments of unmitigated glory in battle.
They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.
Don't let him lead the soldiers, but by all means let him lead the way.
"Forgive me, Master Kami, but in the interest of my people I must halt your advance."

"You think no one is watching, you think you're smart enough to escape, and most foolish of all, you think no one cares."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct
"You call it luck. I call it preparation."
"Swords, to me! We must engage their line to protect our archers and mages. Let no one fail this task!"
"Do you smell something burning?"
"For us, a rope represents the ties that bind the kor. For you, it's more literal."
Goblins are eager to follow orders, especially when those orders involve stealing, hurting, annoying, eating, destroying, or swearing.

"He displays a perverse charisma fueled by avarice. Highly dangerous. Recommend civil sanctions."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar
Formerly oppressed by the polis of Meletis, leonin occasionally "mistake" their old enemies for game.
Sudden vengeance, echoing fury.
Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.
His mission has become a grim pilgrimage, a tour of the Eldrazi-stricken outposts across Zendikar. But he marches on alone, stubborn as the daily dawn.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
"Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."
A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.
When asked how many paths reach enlightenment, the monk kicked a heap of sand. "Count," he smiled, "and then find more grains."

"Only the weak imprison themselves behind walls. We live free under the wind, and our freedom makes us strong."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu
Ogres are driven by passion, rage, and another ogre standing behind them with a whip.
The oni leapt easily from peak to peak, toying with its victims, its voice a purr from the rumbling depths of nightmare.

"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, orcish captain
The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."
—Agosto, Azorius imperator

"The beauty of it is they never see it coming. Ever."
—Razzix, sparkmage
Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.
Keranos is a fickle god, delivering punishment as readily as prophecy.

"Having conviction is more important than being righteous."
—Aurelia
Take two steps north into the unsettled future, south into the unquiet past, east into the present day, or west into the great unknown.
Empowered by generations of strength.

"For its time as a mortal, Anger chose a shell of boiling rock."
—Scroll of Beginnings
When it croaks, so do you.
It's so tough it can frighten itself into hiding.
Anurids have the problem of airborne invaders licked.
Dwarves may teach at the speed of stone, but their results are solid.
"I cover the land with blankets and it sleeps."
He remembers enough of his life to weep for what he has lost.
"Out of my way!"
Experience is a good teacher, not a kind one.
"My destiny is to save others so their destinies may be achieved."
The wizard's spellbook was full of burning questions.

"We have been victims of treachery, of the Cabal, and of our own ambitions. No more."
—Commander Eesha

"‘I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."
—Scroll of Beginnings
"Enough!"

"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept
She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.

"Ah, a faceshredder. Very rare. Nearly unstoppable. Good luck"
—Cabal instructor

"Power often costs too high a price."
—Commander Eesha
Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.
Cephalids shrink from the harsh glare of scrutiny.

"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder
"War glides on the simplest updrafts while peace struggles against hurricane winds. It is the way of the world. It must change."
He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.
He wished for power, but not for the longevity to abuse it.
Magical or not, it's still a cloud.
His battle cry unleashes an avalanche of dwarves.

"Drill the planet, it's no trouble:
Mining granite, making rubble."
—Dwarven drilling song
Barbarians invented the blaze of glory. Dwarves perfected it.
Rats come in one amount: too many.
Nature's strength outlives the strong.
Dwarves bring poor coal to market, use good coal in their homes, and throw their best coal away.

"What you made will be unmade. What you learned will be unlearned. And when you're done, you will be undone."
—Ambassador Laquatus

"If our foes will not listen to words, perhaps hooves and claws will make them take notice."
—Seton, centaur druid
He provides a safe path to nowhere.

"We use only what we need—but in times of strife, our need becomes great."
—Centaur warrior

"As the portal closed, Filth oozed through. The stench of evil followed it in."
—Scroll of Beginnings

"I don't rub salt in wounds. I use sulfur."
—Matoc, lavamancer
Sometimes the healers need healing.
"Our unity renews our strength."

"Raze the body. Raise the soul."
—Mystic elder

"First through the Riftstone was Genesis—and the world was lifeless no more."
—Scroll of Beginnings

"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs."
—Nomad myth

"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings
She wished for nobility, but not for a nation to honor it.
As a youth, Kamahl took one for a pet. His hair has yet to grow back.

"You call that a nightmare?"
—Braids, dementia summoner

"Would you abandon your past to save your future?"
—Ambassador Laquatus

"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer
Scholars possess such lofty knowledge that it shouldn't be surprising when they fall.
"In the end, the same soil lies atop the field, within the mountain, and under the sea."
In the heavy hush of Krosa, drawing on mana is like ringing a dinner bell.

"Why waste time creating weapons? Nature provides us with all we need."
—Centaur warrior
"My brother and I both come from Balthor's forge. Kamahl has a temper of fire. I have a temper of steel."
"I see their moral dilemmas. I see their raw courage. I see their self-sacrifice. I see our victory."

"The Krosan Forest lives, and druids are its seeds."
—Seton, centaur druid
"The first time was amusing, but now you're getting tiresome."

"Never underestimate our enemy's strength, brutality, . . . or stupidity."
—Commander Eesha
Freed from their chains, these dwarves are bound only by honor.
He wished for growth, but not for a way to control it.
Some minds are more open than others.
The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

"Breaking it would be about four hundred years bad luck."
—Nomad sentry
The mind sings, though at times it sings a dirge.

Your past is a map to where you will go.
—Nantuko teaching
Nomads weave tales thicker than tapestries.
"Our unity unmasks your deceit."
"Our unity revives our hopes."

"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan

"That does it—I quit"
—Cabal grave robber
Webs of illusion unravel in the light of truth.

The hippo grows wings to fight the condor.
—Nantuko teaching
The armies paused, silent, as the warriors reflected on the sunsets of their youth.
"Our unity conquers all fears."
A symbol of hope for hopeless times.
The epidemic insanity had a lasting effect on certain barbarians—but no one noticed.
It marks the border between here and hereafter.
"Our unity humbles our foes."
The Mirari's magic transformed the Krosan Forest—and its inhabitants.

"Our forebears once flew like this—carefree, needing nothing but a warm nest and a full belly. Our intellect may be more burden than blessing."
—Commander Eesha
No circle has a beginning, but many have foreseeable ends.
As dust swept out, vultures swept in.

"How could someone so small cause so much trouble?"
—Nomad sentry

"Nature's been fired. The oceans are under new management."
—Ambassador Laquatus

"If we have learned nothing else, we have learned to survive."
—Mystic elder
"When you live for others, you live for yourself."

"The desert asked the Ancestor for children, and the antelope were born."
—Nomad myth
If an anurid's lucky, it'll find a warm tunnel for bedtime. If a wurm's lucky, it'll find a warm anurid for breakfast.

"Only the Ancestor should be revered."
—Mystic heretic

"The cracks widened, the shell crumbled, and Valor spread throughout the land."
—Scroll of Beginnings

"True strength comes from within. The false promise of unnatural power only incurs Krosa's wrath."
—Seton, centaur druid
Cephalids specialize in lose-lose situations.

"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings
Spawned by mages emulating the insane.
Chainer's admirers keep his dreams alive.

"Open the gates, and bid them enter."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"We encountered the Sentinels in the wastes, near no living thing. Their purpose was inscrutable."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"There is no nobler creature in all of Terisiare."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"With this marvel, even the weak have a fighting chance!"
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist
The star that burns twice as bright burns half as long.

"The Shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Those Foxes are wily, swift, and ferocious. They are the warriors of the snows."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"With the proper equipment and caution, one can travel anywhere."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

"I have my faith, and I have my prayers. But if push comes to shove, I've also got a little something extra."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"The dreams of a child fulfilled:
The wind on my brow,
the air 'neath my feet."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage
One Auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

"The pass was completely blocked by the avalanche; we're forced to turn back. Nevertheless, we've gone farther and seen more than any before us."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the Skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an ‘amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

"They're a hardy bunch, but I'd still bet that they just slept through the worst of the cold times."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

"The Goblins would kill to get ahold of this one."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

"In the thick of battle, you must keep your wits about you. Yelling a lot helps, too."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"One day you, too, shall drink the blood of your foes. It is something to look forward to."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"May the bounty of Kjeld enrich your days."
—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

Rattle me bones as I cross the floor
And the bones in your grave will rattle no more.

"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"Let those who bear the brand receive no shelter, no kindness, and no comfort from our people."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

"Get up, blast you! They're attacking! Why are you all so slow?"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"The Shamans of Marit Lage do her bidding in secret, but they do it gladly."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Ouphes love trinkets and love to take them apart. I only wish they wouldn't do so with the magical ones."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

"My foes serve me twice: in dying, and in death."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"Centaurs will kill our Aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

Chub Toad, Chub Toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

"As we followed the ice wall, we had the distinct feeling of being watched. Many of the party wanted to turn back."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
Who knows from whence the winter comes?

"Why do we trade with those despicable Elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"The Elves train our healers, and we keep the Orcs at bay. Most Elvish bargains aren't as fair."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"The duel was going badly for me, and Zur thought I was finished. He boasted that he would eat my soul—but all he ate were his words."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Sometimes, a soul is not ready to complete its journey to the next world."
—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"It's amazing how scared a city kid can get at a dog. Now, of course, I'd cross Terisiare alone, and keep no watch if I had a pack of greys hanging on my flanks as I went."
—Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Few of us left, now. Confounded Yeti have opened all the vents. We'd best hide here with the weapons."
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

"Even the ground is our friend."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"I am older than any Elder Druid before me, and still no child has been born with the Mark to take my place. When will the wheel turn?"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"It is the changing of perception that is important."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"The Kjeldorans keep the Orcs at bay and we train their healers. Most human bargains aren't as fair."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
That which lasts longest serves best.

"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage
Abandon not your faith when others abandon you.

"There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

"Freyalise has cleansed our bodies and minds of the plagues of Kjeldor; all she asks in return is that we keep pure our newly given home in Fyndhorn."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.
Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty.

"Let go your fury, and hone your anger. Become the fist of Freyalise!"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
"The fire of justice burns like nothing else." —Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

"I strive for elegance and speed in my work."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
Freyalise's tears bring life and renewal, though they also bring trouble.

"The very earth seemed alive and made a sound like the writhing of the damned."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

"Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"My mind and spirit are one—a barrier not readily passed."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage
In ashes are the gems of history.

"I have been a warrior for over four hundred years, and yet each generation of Kjeldorans teaches me new tricks. There can be no better allies."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

"Serve me, and live forever."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Only the foolish fear Foxfire."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"We have joined with the Druids of the Juniper Order. Our faith is one."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"Too many of us have died in the explosions that wrack these hills."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

"With a bow like this, the hunting is always good."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko,
Elvish Hunter

"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted Brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"Living side by side with the Elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"I breathed deeply, and suddenly I knew not who or where I was."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
Remove the guardians to ensure your victory.

"Walk slowly when in the nether world, and seek that which calls."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"We were chasing Lim-Dûl when the ridge in front of us suddenly crumbled. I can't believe it was mere coincidence."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

"We are farther west than any could have imagined possible, but I still wish to press on. Unfortunately, huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Even the highest mountain can be ground to dust."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield
If only it had three brains, too.

"AIIIEEEE!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

"We learned this at a dear price: once you cross the great river, get through the Yavimaya forest at top speed."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

One foot in the grave,
firmly planted.

"Before you release a Wolverine from the trap, make sure it's really dead."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

"On this site where Kjeld's blood was spilled, let none raise a fist or deny a beggar."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Someone once said that Hipparions are to Warriors what Aesthir are to Skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"The creature we fought in the western waste was doubly dangerous: mortally wounded, it rebounded and attacked again."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
Warmth is life; heat is peace.

"From the mouths of my servants, my voice shall emerge to shake the souls of my foes."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"This was quite possibly the least pleasant occurrence on the entire expedition."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"The Lemures looked harmless, until they descended on my troops. Within moments, only bones remained."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

"When the earth shakes, and their animals are swallowed up by the ground, perhaps they will think twice before attacking again."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"The scavengers who first found it called it the ‘Bone Crank.' Not a bad name, I'd say."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

"This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first escape it."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"We could feel the Shaman's power, as surely as we felt the storm."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"The drawing of maps is fruitless in the west near the ice walls; the very earth is formless."

"Let them see what is not there and feel what does not touch them. When they no longer trust their senses, that is the time to strike."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"I can't believe they expect me to fight with this rabble. A Goblin in a big mask sends ‘em running for cover."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"I thought the day had brought enough horrors for our ragged band, but the night was far worse."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

"The potential for change lies in all things. Know a thing's nature, know its possibilities, and know it anew."
